g.text: Secondary structure of representatives of the three classes of riboswitches within the purine family. Sequences are based upon those used for
determination of the crystal structure of (
dG riboswitch aptamer domain (PDB ID: 3SKI), and (
-dG riboswitch (this study). The secondary structural elements which are
common to all three classes, are labeled as P (paired), J (joining) and L (loop). Nucleotides highlighted in red directly interact with the ligand nucleobase
and nucleotides in blue within the
sequence represent key differences in the ligand binding three-way junction between the
dashed lines represent two sets of base-base interactions in the junction that distinguish the three classes of riboswitches.

with nucleobase-nucleobase interactions. Base interaction notation is that of Leontis and Westhof (
) Cartoon representation of the crystal structure
riboswitch aptamer domain in complex with 2
-deoxyguanosine (magenta). Watson–Crick helices (P1 – P3) are denoted in blue, the two terminal
loops (L2 and L3) in orange and the three joining regions of the three-way junction (J1
1) are shown in cyan, green and yellow, consistent
In each RNA, the P1 helix was truncated to the three Watson–Crick base pairs proximal to the three way junction. The RNAs align with an r.m.s. deviation
